abstract: Bank customers will be allowed to stop withdrawals for high-interest payday loans and close their accounts sooner.
snippet: Bank customers will be allowed to stop withdrawals for high-interest payday loans and close their accounts sooner.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase will make changes to protect consumers who have borrowed money from a rising power on the Internet — payday lenders offering short-term loans with interest rates that can exceed 500 percent.

headline.main: JPMorgan Chase Is Reining In Payday Lenders

abstract: JPMorgan Chase is making changes to its policy on Internet-based payday lenders. | John C. Malone is moving to re-enter the cable business. | Federal authorities are scrutinizing Microsoft’s involvement with companies and officials accused of paying bribes overseas. | Bill Gross is auctioning off some rare stamps.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is making changes to its policy on Internet-based payday lenders. | John C. Malone is moving to re-enter the cable business. | Federal authorities are scrutinizing Microsoft’s involvement with companies and officials accused of payi...
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase is moving to protect customers whose accounts are tapped by Internet-based payday lenders, planning to give those customers more power to stop withdrawals and close their accounts, Jessica Silver-Greenberg reports in DealBook. Under the changes, to be announced on Wednesday, JPMorgan is also limiting the fees it charges customers when the withdrawals trigger penalties.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s New Policy on Payday Lenders

abstract: MF Global customers moved one step closer to recouping their missing money late on Tuesday when JPMorgan Chase released its claim to more than $500 million belonging to the bankrupt brokerage firm.
snippet: MF Global customers moved one step closer to recouping their missing money late on Tuesday when JPMorgan Chase released its claim to more than $500 million belonging to the bankrupt brokerage firm.
lead_paragraph: MF Global customers moved one step closer to recouping their missing money late on Tuesday when JPMorgan Chase released its claim to more than $500 million belonging to the bankrupt brokerage firm.

headline.main: With JPMorgan Settlement, MF Global Clients Move Closer to Payout
